title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2020, the government has an improved capacity to design, implement, monitor and coordinate policies and strategies related to multi-sectoral nutrition (MSN) interventions.

mailing-address.narrative: Winston Churchill Avenue P.O. Box 1181 Yaoundé

sector.narrative: Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Technical assistance - Prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the government has an improved capacity to design, implement, monitor and coordinate policies and strategies related to multi-sectoral nutrition (MSN) interventions.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the government of Cameroon to foster an enabling environment for the delivery of nutrition interventions. UNICEF also continued to provide guidance and support to the government of Cameroon in implementing multi-sectoral nutrition strategies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Country has a budgeted plan to improve dietary diversity
Implementation of programmes to improve diet diversity in children
Existence of a functional national multisectoral committee for nutrition
Existence of a functional platform for cross-sectoral convergence within the office
Operational plan and common results framework of the national nutrition policy
